metadata.script_title: How I Built a Self-Managing Project System That Cut My Planning Time by 80%

visual_prompts.description: Screen recording of cluttered spreadsheet, multiple browser tabs
visual_prompts.context: Every Monday, I used to spend 2 hours planning projects. Updating spreadsheets. Checking statuses. Remembering what I was working on.

runway.prompt: Sleek digital dashboard: Screen recording of cluttered spreadsheet, multiple browser tabs. Modern UI, glowing elements, dark theme, cinematic lighting, shallow depth of field

kling.prompt: Realistic tech environment: Screen recording of cluttered spreadsheet, multiple browser tabs. Modern office setting, actual screens displaying data, natural lighting, professional workspace

pika.prompt: Modern app interface: Screen recording of cluttered spreadsheet, multiple browser tabs. Vibrant colors, fast transitions, mobile-first design, eye-catching

real_footage.notes: Shows actual working system, builds trust

heygen.script_text: Every Monday, I used to spend 2 hours planning projects. Updating spreadsheets. Checking statuses. Remembering what I was working on.
heygen.notes: Use for intro, key points, transitions

visual_prompts.context: Then I stopped trying to be a better project manager.

runway.prompt: Cinematic b-roll: Close spreadsheet, pull up terminal. Professional lighting, smooth camera movement, 4K quality, color graded

kling.prompt: Photorealistic scene: Close spreadsheet, pull up terminal. Natural lighting, camera movement, high detail, cinematic framing

heygen.script_text: Then I stopped trying to be a better project manager.
heygen.notes: Use for intro, key points, transitions

visual_prompts.context: Instead, I built a project manager. An autonomous system that scans projects, aggregates todos, syncs with GitHub, and updates dashboards automatically. Now I wake up to completed tasks.

runway.prompt: Sleek digital dashboard: Dashboard showing 34 projects, all auto-updated. Modern UI, glowing elements, dark theme, cinematic lighting, shallow depth of field

kling.prompt: Realistic tech environment: Dashboard showing 34 projects, all auto-updated. Modern office setting, actual screens displaying data, natural lighting, professional workspace

pika.prompt: Modern app interface: Dashboard showing 34 projects, all auto-updated. Vibrant colors, fast transitions, mobile-first design, eye-catching

real_footage.notes: Shows actual working system, builds trust

heygen.script_text: Instead, I built a project manager. An autonomous system that scans projects, aggregates todos, syncs with GitHub, and updates dashboards automatically. Now I wake up to completed tasks.
heygen.notes: Use for intro, key points, transitions

visual_prompts.context: My planning time went from 2 hours to 24 minutes. That's 80% of my Monday morning back. And I'll walk you through the exact 3-system architecture that makes it possible.

runway.prompt: High-tech system visualization: "3 SYSTEMS" text overlay. Futuristic interface, holographic elements, blue/purple color palette, cinematic camera movement

heygen.script_text: My planning time went from 2 hours to 24 minutes. That's 80% of my Monday morning back. And I'll walk you through the exact 3-system architecture that makes it possible.

visual_prompts.context: > "Build a Python script that scans /Users/elizabethknopf/Documents/claudec/active/ recursively, finds all CLAUDE.md files, extracts structured data using regex (todos under ## Progress Tracking, status under ## Current Status, phase field), and outputs to projects.json. Run daily via cron at 9 AM."

visual_prompts.context: > "Create a project template generator that: 1) Takes project name as argument, 2) Creates standardized folder structure, 3) Generates CLAUDE.md from template with project-specific fields auto-filled, 4) Finds next available port in range 3000-9000 by checking all existing CLAUDE.md files, 5) Initializes git repo with initial commit, 6) Outputs success message with project path and assigned port."

visual_prompts.context: > "Build a GitHub sync agent that: 1) Scans project list from projects.json, 2) Checks git status in each, 3) For uncommitted changes: analyze diffs and generate commit message describing actual changes, commit with message, push to remote, 4) For feature branches: create PR with detailed summary using gh CLI, 5) For open PRs: check CI status and log failures, 6) Output daily summary of all git operations."
